summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 20, 2019, and produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman and includes a rider detailing the recipient's rights and the scope of requested materials.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney authorizing the document.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The unnamed recipient is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal statutes.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 15, 2019, for an appearance on August 20, 2019, indicating active federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein-related matters after his death.
The subpoena demands production of 'All materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein' including text messages, emails, social media messages, documents, and notes.
The alleged violations under investigation include 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction/alteration of records).
The subpoena explicitly covers materials stored electronically anywhere, including on computers, email accounts, iCloud, servers, cellphones, and devices in the U.S. or foreign jurisdictions.
The recipient is unnamed in the provided text, suggesting this document is likely a template or partially redacted version.
